definition: to ask/to invite/please (do sth)/to treat (to a meal etc)/to request

sentences.english: Jefferson wrote, was the declaration of independence was "the referee" alliance.
sentences.chinese: 杰斐逊曾写道，《独立宣言》是“吁请世界的裁判”。

sentences.english: So I'm asking you all to make your voice heard.
sentences.chinese: 所以，我吁请大家发出你们的声音。

sentences.english: In addition, we are urging staff and students to pay attention to personal hygiene.
sentences.chinese: 此外，我们吁请各员工及学生加强注意个人衞生。

sentences.english: The captain appealed against the light.
sentences.chinese: 球队队长以光线不宜吁请裁判中止比赛。

sentences.english: I invite the leaders in Belgrade and Podgorica to consolidate this trend," De Gucht said.
sentences.chinese: 我吁请塞尔维亚和黑山领导人推进这一民主趋势。

sentences.english: The objectors called on the legislators to defeat the bill.
sentences.chinese: 抗议者吁请立法委员勿通过该法案。

sentences.english: Our captain appealed against the light.
sentences.chinese: 我们队长以光线太暗吁请裁判中止比赛。

definition: to call on (sb to do sth)/to appeal (to)/an appeal
to make a suggestion/to state (one's views, ideas etc)/suggestion/advice/idea
to propose/to put forward (an idea)/to initiate
all walks of life/all social circles
